name: market for diphenylether-compound | diphenylether-compound | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9937/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'diphenylether-compound', in the Global geography.;This product is generally considered to be used at the production site.  Therefore, the market does not contain any transport.;diphenylether-compound' represents an organic substance. The compounds fragment is two benzene rings, fused by an oxygen atom and the molecular formula of the fragment is: -(C6Hx)O(C6Hx)-. The amount of H atoms depends on the amount of substituents on the rings. The compounds are mostly liquid (else solid) under normal conditions of temperature and pressure. The dataset was modelled from the arithmetic mean of all inputs and outputs of the production of several representing substances. The reference product is modelled to represent a pure substance.  On a consumer level, they are used in the following products: herbicides. There is no publicly available information about the consumption of these substances on industrial sites.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'diphenylether-compound',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of  diphenylether-compound', to the consumers of this product. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
